text: Fun facts until I kill myself   We all know the stereotype about Semitic languages like arabic aramiac and Hebrew  they are all written from right to left because it was easier to do that when righting on stone or mud or whatever  right  well there are   exceptions to this rule  for the first one we go to the island of Malta in Italy of all places  malta people speak a daughter language of Tunisie called maltese that share around   to     of words between arabic and Italian  to find the second we go to Africa  where u will find a language called Amharic  it s non cursive and written from left to right  well whats the  rd one then  well this one is complicated  to find this one we should go to the Levant  specifically Lebanon  u see lebanon uses the normale arabic fusha alphabet   but the lebanese people made a new alphabet to write using keyboards  it has many names like arabzi or loghat el whatsapp  but the most used name is karshoun  witch means gibrish in lebanese  it the normal French alphabet but using numbers to add the sounds used in lebanese that isn t found in French  it looks like this    Mar aba ya  ayy  ilna zam n manna sh yfinak wen kil hal  ayb  w r  making lebanese the  rd Semitic language to be written from left to right and one of the only modern languages to have   alphabets one is from right to left and the other in lef to right
summary: Lebanese is the only Semitic language to be written from left to right. Amharic is non cursive and written from right to left. Maltese is a daughter language of Tunisie and it's a mixture of Arabic and Italian.
cleaned: lebanese semitic language write leave right amharic non cursive write right leave maltese daughter language tunisia mixture arabic italian
